thread.title: Here's how you can watch Cubs-Cardinals Game 2
thread.title_full: Here's how you can watch Cubs-Cardinals Game 2

title: Here's how you can watch Cubs-Cardinals Game 2
text:
Here's how you can watch Cubs-Cardinals Game 2 Here's how you can watch Cubs-Cardinals Game 2 
Oct 9, 2015; St. Louis, MO, USA; The St. Louis Cardinals and Chicago Cubs during the national anthem before game one of the NLDS at Busch Stadium. (Scott Rovak/USA Today Sports) Like Sports News on Facebook: reviewjournal.com 
The National League Division Series between the Chicago Cubs and the St. Louis Cardinals continues today at Busch Stadium in St. Louis. The Cardinals lead the series 1-0 after a 4-0 win over the Cubs Friday night. 
Here's everything you need to know if you want to tune in for the game. 
Time: 2:37 p.m. PDT 
TV: TBS (DirecTV 247, Cox 7, Century Link 113, Dish 139) 
Schedule through Game 5 (all times PDT): 
Game 3: Cardinals at Cubs — Monday, Oct. 12, TBD — TBS 
Game 4: Cardinals at Cubs — Tuesday, Oct. 13, TBD — TBS 
Game 5: Cubs at Cardinals — Thursday, Oct. 15, 1:30 p.m. — TBS Comment section guidelines The below comment section contains thoughts and opinions from users that in no way represent the views of the Las Vegas Review-Journal or GateHouse Media. This public platform is intended to provide a forum for users of reviewjournal.com to share ideas, express thoughtful opinions and carry the conversation beyond the article. Users must follow the guidelines under our Commenting Policy and are encouraged to use the moderation tools to help maintain civility and keep discussions on topic.
